summary:
Passionate biologist with 10+ years of laboratory research, having a Licentiate degree in Biological Sciences, Master's in Cell Biology and PhD in Cell Biology. I also have extensive experience in the areas of Molecular Biology, Developmental Biology and Histology, and a bit of Bioinformatics.

⇲ Top skills:
• PCR
• Immunohistochemistry
• In situ hybridization
• Cloning using bacterial plasmids
• Photographic documentation and image processing

⇲ Personal skills:
• Project management
• Interdisciplinary mindset
• Multitasking
• Team work
• Organized
• Attention to detail
• Goal-oriented

projects.title: Analysis of the differential profile of transcripts expressed by the opossum Didelphis albiventris in the early stages of postnatal development
LeishMANIA
projects.description:
The project aims to create a new system of drug production and delivery based on an attenuated strain of Leishmania donovani Centrin1-/-. This system is advantageous because L. donovani can specifically and efficiently infect macrophages and its protein post-translational modifications system are very similar to the ones found in mammals.
In cooperation with Rathenau Instituut (SYNENERGENE).

projects.title: Analysis of FGF2, FGF3 and FGF4 during odontogenesis of Didelphis albiventris molars, a promising model for developmental biology studies
projects.description:
Odontogenesis is guided by a complex signaling cascade in which several molecules, including FGF2-4, ensure all dental groups development and specificity. Most of the data on odontogenesis derives from rodents, which does not have all dental groups. Didelphis albiventris is an opossum with the closest dentition to humans, and the main odontogenesis stages occur when the newborns are in the pouch. In this study, D. albiventris postnatals were used to characterize the main stages of their molars development; and also to establish FGF2, FGF3 and FGF4 expression pattern. D. albiventris postnatals were processed for histological and indirect immunoperoxidase analysis of the tooth germs. Our results revealed similar dental structures between D. albiventris and mice. However, FGF2, FGF3 and FGF4 expression patterns were observed in a larger number of dental structures, suggesting broader functions for these molecules in this opossum species. The knowledge of the signaling that determinates odontogenesis in an animal model with complete dentition may contribute to the development of therapies for the replacement of lost teeth in humans. This study may also contribute to the implementation of D. albiventris as model for Developmental Biology studies.

Resulted in the scientific publication: "FGF2, FGF3 and FGF4 expression pattern during molars odontogenesis in Didelphis albiventris", Acta Histochemica, Mar 2017.

profile_positions.description:
PhD scholarship from CAPES
• In situ hybridization on histological slides
• RNA-Seq sequencing on Illumina platform for Trinity software transcriptome assembly
• Made presentations to teach RNA-Seq to other researchers
• Quantitative PCR
• Data mining for differential expression gene analysis using RStudio, DIAMOND, BiNGO and ClueGO in Cytoscape
• Basic programming in Perl and Shell Script
• Member of the poster evaluation committee during the XXIV Scientific Initiation Week/PRPQ (UFMG, 2015)
• Member of the evaluation committee of posters and abstracts at the III Symposium of Integration of the Postgraduate Programs in Cell Biology of UFV, UFMG and UFU (UFV, 2014)

Project: "Analysis of the differential profile of transcripts expressed by the opossum Didelphis albiventris in the early stages of postnatal development"

Didactic internship of the Postgraduate Program in Cell Biology
Area: Cytology and Histology, totaling 180 hours. 
• Followed, prepared lessons and taught Cell Biology classes for undergraduate courses in Biological Sciences, Medicine and Dentistry at UFMG
• Received great feedback from students in regards to my teaching skills and methodology, creative usage of tools, and high quality presentations and explanations
profile_positions.title: Postgraduate Internship

profile_positions.description:
Member of the iGEM UFMG_Brazil, a research group of Synthetic Biology coordinated by Prof. Dr. Liza Felicori and Prof. Dr. Rafaela Salgado from Biochemistry and Immunology Department (UFMG).
In 2015, our project called "LeishMANIA" was awarded with the Best Education and Public Engagement Prize and was Nominated among the Best Integrated Human Practices at iGEM (International Genetically Engineered Machine), the most famous competition in Synthetic Biology, hold in Boston, U.S.A.
Developed activities:
•	Theoretical and practical development of experimental projects
•	Lectures in the annual courses of synthetic biology promoted by the group and in other events: "Synthetic Biology: what is it which are its applications"
•	Mentorship of undergraduate and Master students during the development of the project
•	Monitoring undergraduate students during the "Idea Incubator" course (45 hours)
•	Organization and mentorship of undergraduate students during the “II Summer Course on Biological Machinery Engineering” (UFMG, 2016)
•	Organization of the “Biological Machinery Engineering” (UFMG, 2016) and “R Software Application for Biostatistics Challenges” (UFMG, 2015) Workshops
profile_positions.title: Member of the iGEM UFMG_Brazil group of Synthetic Biology

profile_positions.title: Masters Student

profile_positions.description:
Developed research projects and collaborated with other researchers, performing:
• Immunohistochemistry on histological slides
• Primer design for gene amplification by PCR
• Agarose gel electrophoresis
• DNA purification from agarose gel
• Processing of histological materials for paraffin embedding
• Microtomy
• Staining and mounting techniques for histological slides
• Photographic documentation and image processing
• Preparing histological solutions, fixatives, buffers and reagents
• Manipulation of graduated pipettes, pH meter and precision scales
• Collection of wild white-eared opossum (D. albiventris)
• Monitor of elementary and high school students of the Educating for Science Course - UFMG & Schools (UFMG, 2011)

Projects:
• Scholarship from FUNDEP/Santander (2009-2010): "Isolation, cloning, sequencing and immunolocalization of fibroblast growth factor-3 (FGF-3) during dental development in embryos of rat and mammalian with complete dentition, the opossum Didelphis albiventris"
• Scholarship from PROBIC/FAPEMIG (2011-2012): "Evaluation of dentin-pulp complex response to different cementing agents"

Besides working on research projects, I also requested quotes for supplies, wrote equipment manuals, made enhancements to protocols and made those available to colleagues.
